triples.name: Time crystal
triples.relevance: The paper's primary subject, reviewing discrete time crystals and their properties

triples.name: Time-translation symmetry
triples.relevance: The breaking of time translation symmetry is the fundamental mechanism behind discrete time crystals

triples.name: Ergodicity
triples.relevance: Ergodicity breaking is identified as the key mechanism enabling discrete time crystal phenomena

triples.name: Josephson effect
triples.relevance: AC Josephson effect is discussed as a phenomenon sharing properties with discrete time crystals

triples.name: Coupled map lattice
triples.relevance: Coupled map lattices are reviewed as systems exhibiting phenomena analogous to discrete time crystals

triples.name: Faraday wave
triples.relevance: Faraday waves are discussed as a classical phenomenon related to discrete time crystal behavior

triples.name: Many-body localization
triples.relevance: Localization is identified as a key strategy to stabilize time crystalline order in closed systems

triples.name: Thermalisation
triples.relevance: Prethermalization is discussed as a mechanism delaying ergodicity and enabling discrete time crystal phenomena

triples.name: Quantum dissipation
triples.relevance: Dissipation is identified as a theoretical strategy to stabilize time crystalline order in open systems

triples.name: Quantum error correction
triples.relevance: Error correction is reviewed as a strategy for stabilizing time crystalline order in quantum systems

triples.name: Quantum simulator
triples.relevance: Many-body quantum simulators are identified as the primary experimental platform for investigating time crystal signatures

triples.name: Trapped-ion quantum computer
triples.relevance: Trapped ion systems are reviewed as an experimental platform for realizing discrete time crystals

triples.name: Spintronics
triples.relevance: Solid-state spin systems are reviewed as experimental platforms for studying time crystalline behavior

triples.name: Superconducting quantum computing
triples.relevance: Superconducting qubits are reviewed as an experimental platform for investigating discrete time crystals
